ranked_diseases.explanation: Prominent fingertip pads are a hallmark feature of Coffin-Siris syndrome. The combination with intellectual disability, developmental delays, autism, and facial dysmorphisms (hypoplastic nasal bridge, thick eyebrows) strongly suggests this diagnosis.
Another subtype of Coffin-Siris syndrome caused by ARID1A mutations, presenting with similar features including prominent fingertip pads, intellectual disability, and facial anomalies.
SMARCB1-related Coffin-Siris syndrome variant with overlapping features including developmental delays, intellectual disability, and characteristic facial features.
Shares several features including intellectual disability, thick eyebrows, and developmental delays. While prominent fingertip pads are more specific to Coffin-Siris, some overlap exists.

ranked_diseases.disease_name: Intellectual developmental disorder with dysmorphic facies and behavioral abnormalities
ranked_diseases.explanation: The reference cases all had this diagnosis with similar features including autism, intellectual disability, and various facial dysmorphisms, though prominent fingertip pads were not specifically mentioned.
Can present with broad thumbs/toes (similar to prominent fingertip pads), intellectual disability, autism, and facial dysmorphisms including hypoplastic nasal bridge.
EP300-related variant of Rubinstein-Taybi syndrome with similar features to type 1, including developmental delays and characteristic facial features.
